classifications.title: SECRET
paragraphs: •  Highly sensitive data intended for limited, specific use by a workgroup, department, or group of individuals with a legitimate need-to-know.
•  Explicit authorization by the Data Steward is required for access because of legal, contractual, privacy, or other constraints.  The Company is contractually obligated to keep them secret.
•  They are critical to the Company's ability to perform one of its essential business functions and cannot be replaced easily with backup copies.
•  Leakage of this information can cause substantial damage to Company.

classifications.title: RESTRICTED
paragraphs: •  Data that must be protected from unauthorized access to safeguard the privacy or security of an individual or organization.
•  Not available to the public, and protection is required by the data owner or other confidentiality and may be required by federal or state law or regulation.
•  The loss of their confidentiality, integrity, or availability could cause harm to Company but not as severe as with Secret Data.
•  They identify an individual and would customarily be shared only with the individual's family, doctor, lawyer, or accountant.

•  Disclosure is limited to individuals on a need-to-know basis. They could be exploited for criminal or other wrongful purposes, and the Company is obligated by federal or state law or regulation to keep them confidential.

classifications.title: INTERNAL
paragraphs: •  Information that must be guarded due to proprietary, ethical, or privacy considerations and must be protected from unauthorized access, modification, transmission, storage or other use. This classification applies even though there may not be a civil statute requiring this protection. Internal Data is information that is restricted to personnel who have a legitimate reason to access it.

classifications.title: PUBLIC
paragraphs: Information that may or must be open to the general public. It is defined as information with no existing local, national, or international legal restrictions on access or usage. Public data, while subject to disclosure rules, is available to all employees and all individuals or entities external to the corporation.
